early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. In-person absentee voting is available for those who qualify.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Voters need to provide a photo copy of an approved ID with their absentee ballot application. Valid forms of ID are listed _here_.[https://www.sos.alabama.gov/alabama-votes/voter/voter-id]

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

mail_in.id_explainer: Voters need to provide a photo copy of an approved ID with their absentee ballot application.

early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Early voting and in-person absentee voting are available.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Photo ID is requested, though some forms of nonphoto ID are also accepted. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a ballot that automatically undergoes additional scrutiny. Valid forms of ID are listed _here_.[https://www.elections.alaska.gov/Core/votingatthepollsonelectionday.php]

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

mail_in.id_explainer: Voters need to provide the ID number from an approved ID when returning their absentee ballot.

early_voting_faq.answer: It varies. Check with your local election office.

early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?

mail_in.id_explainer: ID is not required to vote by absentee ballot.

early_voting_faq.question: Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. ID is requested. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a ballot if they sign an affidavit attesting to their identity. Valid forms of ID are listed _here_. [https://elections.delaware.gov/information/faq/voting.shtml]

mail_in.id_explainer: ID is not required to vote by mail, except for some first-time voters.

early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Early voting and in-person absentee voting are available.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Monday, Oct. 24 for in-person absentee, Friday, Oct. 28 for early voting.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: No. ID is not required to vote early, except for first time mail voters. More information _here_.[https://dcboe.org/Voters/How-to-Vote/Mail-Ballot-Instructions]

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

mail_in.id_explainer: ID is not required to vote by mail, except for first time mail voters.

early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?

early_voting_faq.answer: Saturday, Nov. 5, but some counties might extend this until Sunday, Nov. 6.

mail_in.id_explainer: Voters need to provide an ID number when requesting a mail ballot.

register.youth: Under 18? You can register to vote at 17 ½ and vote at 18.

early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Photo ID is requested when submitting an absentee ballot application. If ID is not provided, voters can have their application notarized. More information _here_.[https://sdsos.gov/elections-voting/voting/absentee-voting.aspx]

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

answer: Commissioner of School and Public Lands

early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. ID is required. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a provisional ballot if they sign an affidavit attesting to their identity. Valid forms of ID are listed _here_. [https://sos.wv.gov/elections/Pages/BeReg.aspx]

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

mail_in.id_explainer: ID is not required, except for first-time voters casting an absentee ballot, who must provide a copy of a valid form of ID with their ballot.

early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. In-person absentee voting is available.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Photo ID is required. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a provisional ballot, but must provide valid ID to their municipal clerk at a later date in order for their ballot to be counted. Valid forms of ID are listed _here_.[https://myvote.wi.gov/Portals/0/Documents/gab_123is_provisional_voting_information_sheet_20_31072.pdf]

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

mail_in.id_explainer: Photo ID must be provided when requesting an absentee ballot.

early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. In-person absentee voting is available.

When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Photo ID is required. Valid forms of ID are listed _here_.[https://sos.wyo.gov/faqs.aspx?root=ELEC]

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

mail_in.id_explainer: ID is required only for voters who registered by mail and are voting absentee for the first time.
